data.title: Engine crashes if MessageBox.xml is not present

data.body:
The material editor need a image loader for channel alpha(from texture), displacement map, detail map.

data.title: Attribute inspector drop down list behind main window
data.body:
1. Create new node in editor with collision shape component
2. Try to change collision shape by clicking drop down list with shape types - renders fine
3. try again
4. Drop down list is rendered behind attribute inspector window and it can't be clicked

Win 7, Enabled OpenGL, 32 bit

data.title: Oculus Rift Integration
data.body:
Hello! 

I have experience developing with the OculusRift in C++, and I would be interested in integrating the Oculus with Urho3D so it can easily be used as a component.

This may take some time because I am in a game development course at university, and the workload does not favour any spare time. That being said, the game I am making this semester (I chose Urho for the engine) will be using the Oculus, so I'll write a C++ integration in my local project and then port it to the engine once it's done. I've done this before in Ogre, so I know the necessary operations with the engine's components, such as shaders and viewports.

The latest I can see this being completed would be April.

data.title: Build:  have visual studio cmake sln files reference _d files for out of source builds in debug mode
data.body:
This issue is easily fixable manually but I was wondering if there was a way to iron this kink out.  I ran my visual studio cmake bat file on an out of source build and the references to the .lib file are to the Urho3D.lib and not the Urho3D_d.lib file.  The result is an error: 

```
Error   44  error LNK2038: mismatch detected for '_ITERATOR_DEBUG_LEVEL': value '0' doesn't match value '2' in Main.obj
```

I can easily go into my settings and change it to the _d file.  It just nice when things work seamlessly out of the box.  If there is something we can tweak in the cmake to have the project reference the _d files for debug builds that might be a nice touch.  I am not a cpp guy, so I don't understand the conventions.  If I am out of place feel free to close this immediately.

data.title: Blender Exporter "Incompatible vertex element mask"
data.body: I have been using the Blender exporter with no problems for quite some time now- the automatic LODs-from-names feature is particularly handy. Unfortunately, as I recently discovered, attempting to export a LOD model with tangents gives me an "Incompatible vertex element mask" error, and the resulting model, once imported into my application, seems to have all LODs present at once, with any normal-mapped surfaces not being rendered at all. I'm fairly certain this is a bug with the exporter, as I can export each LOD individually with no problems, then use the AssetImporter tool to put them together in one file, and then it works without problems. However, this is cumbersome and does not scale well at all.

data.title: F5 does not save custom component (ScriptInstance) correctly for Editor editing
data.body:
At the moment during loading of a scene, Editor just logs an error entry when encountering custom component (created by Node::CreateScriptObject() in scripting API). For example, the "Character" class in the CharacterDemo. It would be useful if the Editor can recognize it as, say, ScriptInstance component and allows user to modify its attributes. Creating a new ScriptInstance component in the Editor, save, and reload it back does not have this problem.

EDIT: just to clarify it further, the XML scene is created by using F5 when running the demo. I change the subject to reflect the actual issue.

data.title: UI: hierarchy, change order of siblings with drag
data.body: You can't change the order of siblings inside a hierarchy.  The code probably can't tell the difference between re-parenting and changing the order.  I think one way of handling this is to insert a spacer element after every element.

data.title: NoTextureNormal Technique
data.body: This is just a technique I would find useful, and I believe others would too: a non-textured (i.e. solid-colored) pass with a normal map. I'm not completely sure on how the shader permutations are calculated under the hood, so to anyone who's willing to add this: it'd be great!

data.title: Editor: Multiple editor viewports
data.body:
This adds the ability to have multiple viewports in the Editor.  I havn't added orthographic camera support so I don't pass my wife's merciless standards but I think this bit is working pretty well.  I tried to be thorough, give it a shot and let me know if there are any problems.

Here is my criticisms:
- From a ux stand point i feel like the borders are hard to grab.
- The code is a bit heavy handed and brute forced.  The only way I could make the code simpler with my knowledge would be to have some sort of observer but there it isn't very easy to do inside of angelscript.

Thanks :heart: :metal:
Chris

data.title: Mingw-w64/GCC/D3D Static build fails at linking Urho3DPlayer.exe
data.body:
Fails with the error "undefined reference to Direct3DCreate9@4"

Until recently, the link process for me has resulted in (something like; I don't remember the specific wording) Direct3DCreate9@4 doesn't exist, resolving by linking to <something similar, just with different numbers>. Recently, though, it doesn't even want to do that anymore, and just fails with an error.

data.title: Mingw/GCC Build fails @ D3D9Graphics.cpp line 64
Add support for SDL2 GameControllers
data.body:
This is mostly the same as the current joystick code.  However, the SDL game controller code maps buttons to a predefined interface, which is more convenient.

E_CONTROLLERBUTTONDOWN, E_CONTROLLERBUTTONUP, and E_CONTROLLERAXISMOVE are the new events added.

Button returned can be determined by the following variables:
CONTROLLER_BUTTON_A
CONTROLLER_BUTTON_B
CONTROLLER_BUTTON_X
CONTROLLER_BUTTON_Y
CONTROLLER_BUTTON_BACK
CONTROLLER_BUTTON_GUIDE
CONTROLLER_BUTTON_START
CONTROLLER_BUTTON_LEFTSTICK
CONTROLLER_BUTTON_RIGHTSTICK
CONTROLLER_BUTTON_LEFTSHOULDER
CONTROLLER_BUTTON_RIGHTSHOULDER
CONTROLLER_BUTTON_DPAD_UP
CONTROLLER_BUTTON_DPAD_DOWN
CONTROLLER_BUTTON_DPAD_LEFT
CONTROLLER_BUTTON_DPAD_RIGHT

Axis returned can be determined by the following variables:
CONTROLLER_AXIS_LEFTX
CONTROLLER_AXIS_LEFTY
CONTROLLER_AXIS_RIGHTX
CONTROLLER_AXIS_RIGHTY
CONTROLLER_AXIS_TRIGGERLEFT
CONTROLLER_AXIS_TRIGGERRIGHT

Tested on an Xbox 360 controller and it worked correctly.

Feature request here: https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/issues/21

data.title: Force to use nvidia card when two graphics cards are available
Refract pass will output black if hardware multisampling is in use
data.body: Refract pass does not currently resolve properly when hardware multisampling is in use; instead the output will be completely black. This can be seen in the water example.

data.title: Use color Clang diagnostics when using Ninja build system
data.body: I was testing the Ninja build system and noticed that the Clang diagnostics were monochrome.  This patch forces Clang to use color diagnostics when used with Ninja.

data.title: Added a convenience function to find the angle between two vectors.
data.body: In working with more code where +Y is not necessarily up, I've been often using a convenience function in my personal branch that returns the angle between two vectors. This might be useful for others, as well, so I've decided to propose it as a change.

data.title: Script - IntVector2 x,y readonly
data.body:
The docs say that the properties are not readonly but they are.  From an api standpoint I like the idea of being able to change the individual x,y components but I don't know the trade offs.  Regardless either changing the api or the docs would fix this.
### IntVector2

Methods:
- String ToString() const

Properties:
- int[] data (readonly)
- int x
- int y

data.title: Convenience Functions
data.body:
In my current project with Urho3D, I'm finding the need to use certain functions related to node orientation and positioning. To facilitate easier use of such operations, I propose the following set of additions:
- A method for the quaternion class to allow for [normalized linear interpolation](http://keithmaggio.wordpress.com/2011/02/15/math-magician-lerp-slerp-and-nlerp/) as a cheaper means for interpolation quaternions.
- A quaternion utility class to be constructed to represent a "look toward" rotation, with the input parameters being the desired direction and the desired up vector for the rotation.
- Methods for the Node class to retrieve the parent- and world-space right and up vectors in a similar manner to the `Node::GetDirection()` and `Node::GetWorldDirection()` functions. 

The commit code includes these functions as well as the associated Lua/AS APIs.

data.title: DrawDebugGeometry broken (lua)
data.body:
DrawDebugGeometry () for PhysicsWorld seems to be broken in lua (works fine with angel script and for NavigationGeometry).

For example running Example_11.lua, I get an error message (nil value).

data.title: Add a simple spline component with Bezier Curve Interpolation
Support of physics ?
data.body:
Hi. I reading the docs of engine and have

> Basic physics
> Ragdolls
> Constraits
> but don't find about this:
> Have support or will have for inverse kinematic in animated models (like characters).
> Gravity zones, speed zones, water volumes or wind zones... for physics?
> Cloth (flag for example or character cloth).
> Ropes like source engine or cryengine.
> Breakable object, destroyable object and deformable object(1 static physics to dynamic physics, 2 model change, 3 the wireframe of object change in real time).
> And the physics in the particles(collision with ground...) ?

And other question, in network all physics are sync ?
Don't have 2 class of physics to sync or not ? (big objects and very small objects like cans) 

This is one of the best engines, nice work.
Thanks.
